message.content:
A pineapple is a tropical fruit that belongs to the bromeliad family.
It has a typically oval shape with a rough, scaly, and greenish-brown skin.
The flesh of the pineapple is a vibrant yellow or orange color, with a juicy and fibrous texture.
The fruit has a slightly sweet and tart flavor, with a distinctive tropical aroma.
Pineapples can grow up to 30 centimeters in length and weigh up to 9 kilograms.
They are used in a variety of culinary recipes, such as juices, smoothies, salads, and desserts.
Pineapples are typically found in tropical regions and are a popular export crop.
